intro: Sasamorpha igaensis, commonly known as the Igaensis sasamorpha, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
